@glenglassaugh love it!!! Miss you!

@glenglassaugh All of them! They're my pals from this warehouse.

@ScotchClubYEG glad you've been enjoying it, no news right now but keep your eyes peeled!
@glenglassaugh Love them all.Wonderful coastal charm,delightfully floral and complex drams despite young age #whisky https://t.co/m0vq3tZgwi
@whiskygirl6 great stuff, glad to hear it!

@glenglassaugh  amazing. I just bottled my own octave from glenglassaugh....top drawer

My dream job... @glenglassaugh

@glenglassaugh CU in Frankfurt (Sunday)
@glenglassaugh @HiConsumption have to agree with this really love the 30 year old compared to the 35 year old which I found to sweet .
@glenglassaugh Impressive ! I loved the way nature took over the old guest house though. What about the old malting building ?
@glenglassaugh fantastic news Alisdair hopefully see you at hampden on Nov 14th
@glenglassaugh would like a wee chat as well if possible if your there on the 14th
@glenglassaugh Indeed, celebrating the day the best way I know how - @Glendronach - keeping it in the family. http://t.co/EIFIVWmDP5
@glenglassaugh Congratulations! I just bought my first bottle of Glenglassaugh (The Torfa) last week and it was fantastic!
@ScotchClubYEG Thank you! glad you enjoyed the Torfa and hope it means you'll be buying more:)
@glenglassaugh so happy for you guys. Keep up the great work!

http://t.co/YE2e7ukSzB #WWA15”
@glenglassaugh congratulations! http://t.co/elKir0pome
@WhiskyOss Thank you!
“@glenglassaugh: Such a beautiful location at Glenglassaugh Distillery, overlooking the white sandy beach of Sandend Bay.." Absolutely!
@glenglassaugh At last ! I've been told (2 years ago) this would be released… Congrats on this one !
@glenglassaugh Can't wait to meet you on monday !
@glenglassaugh - Hi there, what minis do you have at the gift shop?
@glenglassaugh Come to Paris and I will join for sure ;-)
@glenglassaugh - Any of them coming on miniature also?
@glenglassaugh - Hi there, will that be available as a miniature?
@MiniMalts Yes but no idea when. Sometime soon...
“@glenglassaugh: Officially released our newest expression, a 30YO, today! http://t.co/XutmJrNcBU” #whisky
Makes a change from the stunning weather we've been having recently (shown in my profile pic) !
@glenglassaugh Where are the surfers ?
@LaCaveDeCobalt Probably half way to Sweden by now :-)
I guess not! I'm off to Yalta to source Massandra casks. It's meant to be quite beautiful down in Sth Ukraine #whiskyfun
@glenglassaugh Massandra Connection part 2, on its way I presume…
@lacavedecobalt The results have been superb so yes we are looking to continue in future. We've still got in-cask stocks for the next year.
@ardbeggadon98 I am very excited. It's not often I get to see the sun as whisky salesmen usually follow the cold around the world :(
@ardbeggadon98 Aye, 10+ distilleries in Tassie. I know them well. V nice. The 'new' Aussie gold ;)
@ardbeggadon98 With respect, it's much like Scotland: small population, cold weather & lots o crystal clear water (ie rain) for distillation
@glenglassaugh Lovely pics! when were they taken?
@yoavgel Answer: No idea! Production stopped in 1907 for a long time & smoke is seen in the photos, so I guess just prior to 1907.
@glenglassaugh Real ancient history. Amazing those pics survived. Were they found in the distillery or in the village?
@yoavgel Passed down from owner to owner, I believe. When we bought Glendronach Chivas/PR provided a box of photos. V nice tradition.
@glenglassaugh just wow. really. I should visit there during my October trip, but oh so many... Glendronach is already in the plan
@glenglassaugh count me in... ;-)
@TheWhiskyBoys @glenglassaugh i'm going too Nicola, we can share a dram on the train north :)
@glenglassaugh Any plans for the release of this 50yo cask Stuart talked to me about ?
@lacavedecobalt Yes, the first 50yo cask will be bottled this year. There's a few of them on site. V exciting times.
@glenglassaugh always happy to help mate. when? where? ;)
@galg Come along anytime. I usually just leave the warehouse keys under the doormat so help yourself. Don't tell anyone now ;-)
@glenglassaugh i'm only a couple hours away so i can help :)
@ifotou It's a tough job. No really, it is!
@glenglassaugh booked flight to Scotland, should be there in 6 hours ready to work!!  ;)
@glenglassaugh don't work too hard  :)     I'm guessing a couple of those are mine - take your time on those.
@glenglassaugh I will gladly help, as long as I can do it from my couch.
@zachfx The warehouses themselves were probably not original but they are super old. Huge wooden roof trusses with tons of slate above.
@ZacHFX Actually, I've researched more overnight & those warehouses are indeed originals from 1875. I'll show you the old photo later!
@DramStats Ha ha that's hilarious. Good one. U hope you DM'ed then and asked their age ?? @OliverKlimek
@glenglassaugh Glad to hear that parts of the industry are equally fed up with this rubbish.
@glenglassaugh Thanks for follow.   Still got wee bottles of 26 and 37 to enjoy. Good luck with the project. Watching with excited interest
@SMWSambassador Do let us know what you think of them? We'd love to hear: good or bad ... but obviously mostly good ;)
@glenglassaugh #Slainte :-)
@glenglassaugh #Evolution rather than #Revolution? I understand the the re packaging is too bring more consistency in packaging for products
@TheWhiskyOracle And I know many staff @LaphroaigWhisky so no issues but my point is that it is a slight tweak rather than a 'brand revamp'
@glenglassaugh I don't think we'd get away with revamping the whole brand! It was indeed to make our selection a smarter portfolio.
@laphroaigwhisky When it ain't broke, don't fix it. Laphroaig is a globally recognised and loved brand.
@glenglassaugh @laphroaigwhisky indeed. keep it simple, ppl like and recognize it from afar, knowing what to expect. peat, peat and peat!
@galg @glenglassaugh @laphroaigwhisky although I'd to see limited edition unpeated :-)
@yoavgel God no, pls don't even suggest it. There's too much jiggery-pokery in the industry already!!
@glenglassaugh :-) just wishful thinking, wondering how is the spirit without peat impact. I'm quite satisfied with current lineup :-)
@yoavgel Hold your nose while your drinking it adn you'll get a pretty good idea! (okay, I'm joking!)
@glenglassaugh LOL
@glenglassaugh Re @LaphroaigWhisky packaging. @Bruichladdich do a lovely job of packaging recent expressions with consistent house style
@TheWhiskyOracle And I'm sure we all agree that @Bruichladdich will focus their branding/design for big launch into the Asian market
@glenglassaugh Hi Don, hope all is well? Look forward to hearing about all the new developments at GG.
@TheWhiskyWire There's tons going on. Its more a matter of time to write them down!   I guess 40 workers on 8 projects last week only! !
@glenglassaugh Donald, welcome to Twitter. Stop by warehouse4 some day, me an' the hogsheads will put the kettle on, open the Jaffa cakes!
@glenglassaugh All the best to all of you, but without those Dutch investors 4,5 years ago Glenglassaugh probably was still mothballed...
@glenglassaugh Wow - now only another too many years to wait to try this, damn
@wanderingpict but just think how good it could be. Maybe another IWSC trophy winner.
@glenglassaugh hope that you have a successful day.
@gmcnevin Soon it'll be the taste of yours! @glenglassaugh #Glenglassaugh Massandra Sherry style finish- video tasting http://t.co/Yzh7wn75
@glenglassaugh & a very worthy achievement too! Wonderful whiskies abound at 1 of the best kept secrets in the whisky world.
@glenglassaugh surely the 26.
@glenglassaugh Tasted both May 3rd at Masterclass. 26 yo was GREAT-sherry, fruit, delicate,complex; Revival = great promise - light, citrusy
@glenglassaugh thanks! we are very excited about the first issue! :)
@glenglassaugh see website http://t.co/TLCOvPUT. Kompas Texel Nethrlands
